questions.question: The consequence of his carelessness was ………………………… he failed.
…………………………….. I am successful does not necessarily make me happy.
questions.description: That clauses do not normally stand alone as subjects. We use the expression ‘the fact that’ instead of ‘that’.

questions.question: The news ………………………….. the captain was killed spread like wild fire.
questions.description: A noun clause can be used in apposition to a noun. In most cases, this is introduced by that.

questions.question: He sold the horse …………………………… belonged to his brother.
questions.description: In identifying relative clauses that and which can both refer to things or animals.

questions.question: I have no pen …………………………… I can lend.
questions.description: That is common after words like no, none, nothing etc.

questions.question: A man …………………………. is dead needs no comforts.
The camel …………………………… was bought from Arabia is very big.
questions.description: In identifying relative clauses both which and that can refer to animals and things.

questions.question: I found the key …………………………. I had lost.
questions.description: We use which to refer to things.

questions.question: You can eat as much …………………………… you want.
The master was annoyed …………………………. his servant had not carried out his orders.
……………………………. there is life, there is hope.
questions.description: As long as is used to indicate a condition.
